result.execSummary:
Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

chargeModifiers.descr: PTAC, as a Party to a Crime

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Kevin O Sylvas

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Justice Point DISCHARGE SUMMARY; filed.  (For failure to present for scheduled contacts.)
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (Missed office contact, missed drug test, and missed breathalyzer test on 01-22-2015.)

Defendant Kevin O Sylvas in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Upon State's motion and pursuant to negotiations, Court ordered Count #1 dismissed and read-in for sentencing purposes.

The 02-16-2015 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date is now CANCELLED.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (Missed telephone contact.)

Defendant Kevin O Sylvas in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties unable to proceed with a Final Pretrial Conference today.
State's essential witness is unable to appear on the 11-10-2014 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date.
State requests an adjournment for the Final Pretrial Conference and Jury Trial.
No objections.
Court GRANTS request.

Court addressed defendant's Justice Point Violation from 09-30-2014:  Defendant received a Justice Point violation for testing positive for THC.  Court admonished defendant for receiving the violation and warned him his release on bail is at stake.

Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 01-22-2015 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 02-16-2015 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
**Court CANCELLED the 11-10-2014 at 8:30 AM Jury Trial date before Judge Donald's Court.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (Positive drug screen for THC on 2 occasions.)
to Adjourn filed by ADA Timothy Cotter on behalf of the State.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services Report; received and filed.

Defendant Kevin O Sylvas in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Jury Trial today, however, the parties are unable to proceed.
Judge Donald is currently in trial on an unrelated matter.
Court finds good cause to adjourn the trial.
Case adjourned for Final Pretrial Conference on 10-15-2014 at 8:30 AM and Jury Trial on 11-10-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.
JusticePoint Pretrial Services "Violation" Report; received and filed.  (New arrest - case#14CF3210.)

Defendant Kevin O Sylvas in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Final Pretrial Conference held.
Parties still in a trial posture.
There are no trial issues.
Case remains calendared for Jury Trial on 08-06-2014 at 8:30 AM - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

Defendant Kevin O Sylvas in court with attorney Vincent P Guimont.  Timothy J Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

This matter was originally scheduled for a Final Pretrial Conference today, however, the parties are unable to proceed.
Judge Donald's Court is down on the scheduled Jury Trial date of 06-30-2014 at 8:30 AM.
Clerk reschedules the Final Pretrial Conference and the Jury Trial dates.
  Stipulated request for adjournment received and filed.
Case adjourned to 06-27-2014 at 8:30 AM for Final Pretrial Conference AND 08-06-2014 at 8:30 AM for Jury Trial - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

**MATTER HEARD BY JUDGE WAGNER FOR JUDGE DONALD.....
Defendant Kevin O Sylvas in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

Parties request a Final Pretrial Conference date and a Jury Trial date.
Court GRANTS request.
Case adjourned to 05-29-2014 at 8:30 AM for Final Pretrial Conference AND 06-30-2014 at 8:30 AM for Jury Trial - Br. 2, Judge Donald's Court.

**All motions are to be circulated and  filed with the court within 21 days.
**Witness lists are to be circulated and filed with the court by the Final Pretrial Conference date.

FILED, Justice Point Pretrial Report.

Certification of transcript of proceedings of PRELIMINARY HEARING   commencing  MARCH 3, 2014  received and filed. (14 Pages.)
Copy of transcript forwarded to  Vincent Guimont - SPD  819 N 6th Street  Milwaukee, WI  53203.

Defendant Kevin O Sylvas in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Joanne Hardtke for Timothy J. Cotter appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the state:Troy Nitschke-Glendale Police Department Detective.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and pleads not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for March 19, 2014 at 08:30 am.

Filed, Justice Point Pretrial Program Report dated 2/28/14.
css

Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with JASON S.
  Court advised defendant that failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.

Court orders defendant TURNED OVER to JUSTICE Point for Supervision.  ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY  to be monitored by drug testing and portable breathalyzers.
   Court ordered no possession or use of controlled substances without a valid prescription AND no dangerous weapons or firearms.
  Defendant advised if released from custody it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings.
Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping, a warrant issued or high cash bail.

Defendant Kevin O Sylvas in court with attorney Vincent Guimont.  Defendant Kevin O Sylvas in custody.  Jesica Ballenger appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk:  hgj.  Defendant given a copy of complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge DONALD, Branch 2.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2014 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
